00037 #include "egs_timer.h"
00038 #include "egs_functions.h"
00039 
00040 #ifdef WIN32
00041 #include <ctime>
00042 
00043 class EGS_PrivateTimer {
00044 public:
00045     EGS_PrivateTimer() : mark(clock()) {};
00046     unsigned long mark;
00047     void start() {
00048         mark = clock();
00049     };
00050     EGS_Float time() {
00051         EGS_Float cpu = clock();
00052         return (cpu - mark)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC;
00053     };
00054 };
00055 
00056 #else
00057 
00058 #include <sys/times.h>
00059 #include <unistd.h>
00060 
00061 clock_t clps = 0;
00062 
00063 #ifndef SKIP_DOXYGEN
00064 
00070 class EGS_PrivateTimer {
00071 public:
00072     tms tstart, tend;
00073     EGS_PrivateTimer() {
00074         if (!clps) {
00075             clps = sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK);
00076         }
00077         times(&tstart);
00078     };
00079     void start() {
00080         if (times(&tstart) < 0) {
00081             egsWarning(" times returned < 0???\n");
00082         }
00083     };
00084     EGS_Float time() {
00085         times(&tend);
00086         EGS_Float cpu = tend.tms_utime;
00087         return (cpu - tstart.tms_utime)/clps;
00088     };
00089 };
00090 #endif
00091 
00092 #endif
00093 
00094 EGS_Timer::EGS_Timer() {
00095     p = new EGS_PrivateTimer;
00096 }
00097 
00098 EGS_Timer::~EGS_Timer() {
00099     delete p;
00100 }
00101 
00102 void EGS_Timer::start() {
00103     p->start();
00104 }
00105 
00106 EGS_Float EGS_Timer::time() {
00107     return p->time();
00108 }
